title: Edwin Julio Palomino Cadenas (0000-0002-4589-6774) - ORCID | Connecting Research and Researchers

biography.value:
Bachelor in Biological Sciences from the National University of San Cristóbal de Huamanga (UNSCH) in June 1986; Microbiologist at the same university in July 1987; Master of Science with mention in Microbiology - Biotechnology at the Universidad Peruana Cayetano Heredia (UPCH) in June 2001; Doctor in Environmental Sciences at the National University of Trujillo in February 2008. Principal Professor in the Faculty of Environmental Sciences of the National University "Santiago Antúnez de Mayolo". Postgraduate Professor at UNASAM, UNSCH and UNAS. President of the Organizing Committee of the UNJ (2015) and of the UNIA (2017-2018).
Researcher of high Andean medicinal and wetland plants; Researcher in ecological sanitation and bioremediation. Researcher in the Project "Study of Wildlife" Barrick Misquichilca Mining Company. Coordinator for INRENA in the Diagnosis of Biological Diversity of the Huaraz Regional Center - Ancash. Coordinator of the Pediatric Emergency Hydration Laboratory of the Cayetano Heredia Hospital. Researcher in the Helicobacter pylori Project, UPCH University - Johns Hopkins University; Researcher for the Naval Medical Research Institute Detachment (NAMRID) - UPCH - Johns Hopkins University School of Public Health. Among the honorific distinctions stand out: First National Prize in health sciences, Instituto Hipólito Unanue Foundation (1994); CONCYTEC Prize (1994) in the Environment, Ecology and Human Habitat Area. First Prize for the best innovation project at the International Congress Sustainable Water Management: Reuse, Treatment and Quality Evaluation; Colombia (2008). Visiting Professor at the Universities of Remington - Colombia; Toribio Rodríguez de Mendoza University - Amazonas.
It develops research, consultancy and prospection of Andean biodiversity and environmental biotechnology (bioassays and bioremediation)
